Stuff I’ve worked on, or have been working on:

Data Science Education Program – Modules

  • Curriculum Developer: In Spring 2018, under UC Berkeley’s Division of Data Sciences, I made Jupyter Notebooks for LEGALST-190: Data, Prediction, and Law. I developed notebooks that cover XML parsing and topic modelling.

  • Team Lead: For the summer and fall of 2018, I continued working with the Division as a team lead. I had two projects this summer, working on UGBA-96: Data and Decisions with Professor Conrad Miller and ER-190C: Data, Environment, and Society with Professor Duncan Callaway. For UGBA-96, I lead a team of three developers implementing autograders for six Jupyter notebooks and for ER-190C, I worked with developers to create the homeworks and labs for this brand new course.

Other fun stuff:

An exploration of the Billboard Top 100 songs
This is a personal project in which I explored the Billboard Top 100 songs form 1965 to 2015. I implemented topic models and various visualizations and you can interact with the graphs! (Note: ipywidgets doesn’t work with GitHub preview).
